items.title: Dragon Ball Super 2 Won’t Be The Same Without Tatsuya Nagamine
bullets: • Tatsuya Nagamine passed away in August 2026 after fighting a year-long battle with an undisclosed illness
• His death was only announced by Nagamine’s colleagues months later on X, as Japanese culture is infamously very private when it comes to death
• It would not be hyperbole to call Nagamine the saving grace of the DBS anime

items.title: Trump news at a glance: in a U-turn, president tells Republicans to vote to release Epstein files
bullets: • Donald Trump has told his fellow Republicans in Congress to vote for the release of files related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein

• The US president’s post on his Truth Social website came after the House speaker, Mike Johnson, said previously that he believed a vote on releasing justice department documents in the Epstein case should put to rest allegations “that he [Trump] has something to do with it” The White House has struggled to contain suspicion within Trump's usually loyal base

items.title: UCLA faculty gets big win in suit against Trump’s university attacks
bullets: • A US District Court issued a preliminary injunction blocking federal funding at UCLA or any other school in the University of California system

• The ruling came in response to a suit filed by groups representing faculty at these schools challenging the Trump administration’s attempts to force UCLA into a deal that would substantially revise instruction and policy
• The court finds that this plan was deficient on multiple grounds, from violating legal procedures for cutting funding to an illegal attempt and suppressing the First Amendment rights of faculty

items.title: Deadly in Small Doses: New Research Shows the Lethal Effects of Ingested Plastic on Marine Animals
bullets: • A 300-pound adult green sea turtle has about a 50 percent chance of survival after swallowing two golf balls’ worth of plastic bags and food wrappers
• Less than a soccer ball’s volume of fishing line or nets is enough to kill nearly all sea lions, seals, dolphins and porpoises
• Exposure to macroplastics, bigger than the width of a pencil, is widespread and often deadly for animals studied

• Starbuck claimed Google’s AI falsely associated him with sexual assault allegations and a white nationalist
• Google says it shouldn’t be held responsible for alleged hallucinations by its AI

items.title: OpenAI is finally letting employees donate their equity to charity
bullets: • Current and former employees with eligible shares will be able to participate
• The company’s price per share has gone up significantly
• It could give employees who got six-figure equity deals in 2019 the chance to donate millions of dollars to charity
• A source familiar with the situation told The Verge that the company is about 18 months late in delivering on its promise

items.title: Google updates its weather forecasts with a new AI model
bullets: • Google debuted a new and improved AI weather model today that will be incorporated into popular products like Search, Gemini, and Pixel phones
• The new model, WeatherNext 2, can generate forecasts eight times faster than Google’s previous model, and is more accurate in predicting 99.9 percent of variables like temperature or wind

items.title: Google Calendar can finally block off time without faking a meeting
bullets: • Google Calendar can block off time for tasks and mark yourself as busy
• The update expands the existing Tasks feature in Calendar
• It effectively allows tasks to function like meetings, including options to set (and adjust) a specific block of time
• You can also add a deadline, but only the date

items.title: NetChoice sues Virginia to block its one-hour social media limit for kids
bullets: • Tech industry trade group NetChoice is suing Virginia over a new law that will restrict minors from using social media for more than one hour per day
• The law would require social media platforms to limit how much time kids under 16 spend on their sites, with parental permission required for longer sessions

items.title: Ticket prices increased 5% in Q3 vs. 2024
bullets: • In Q3, despite a decline in overall box office performance compared to 2024, the average ticket price reached $11.79, with an annual inflation rate of 5%, consistent with the second quarter
• While attendance fell year over year, average ticket prices continued to rise due to ongoing pricing strategies and the expansion of premium formats
